SEARCH
Module FloWeekTracker
Package com.floweektracker.controller

Class MainPanelController

java.lang.Object
com.floweektracker.controller.MainPanelController
public class MainPanelController extends Object
Represents the controller for the MainPanelView class. This class handles the interactions and logic related to the main panel view, including initializing and managing listeners for UI components such as buttons and dialogs.

Fields: taskAddingDialogController, plannerController, cleanerService, plannerService, tasksService, taskNamesController, view, weekdayPlannerService

Methods: areButtonsWithoutListeners(), addListenerToButtons(), createInfoButtonListener(), createCleanerListener(int), deleteTask(), isSelectedValueATask(String), deleteTasksForWeekdays(List), resetPoints(List)

  • Method Details

    • addListenerToButtons

      public void addListenerToButtons()
      Adds listeners to the buttons in the view. Each button is associated with specific actions such as opening dialogs or deleting tasks.
      See Also:
      • createInfoButtonListener()
      • deleteTask()
      • createCleanerListener(int)
      • MainPanelController(MainPanelView, TaskAddingDialogController)

    • deleteTasksForWeekdays

      void deleteTasksForWeekdays(List<WeekDays> weekdays)
      Deletes tasks for the specified weekdays. When List is null, it breaks the action. Otherwise, it deletes all tasks from the TasksService, PlannerService and WeekdayPlannerService.
      Parameters:
      weekdays - the list of weekdays for which tasks should be deleted
      See Also:
      • createCleanerListener(int)
      • addListenerToButtons()

    • resetPoints

      void resetPoints(List<WeekDays> weekdays)
      Resets the points for tasks on the specified weekdays, marking them as not done. When List is null, it breaks the action. Otherwise, it resets the points for all tasks from the TasksService, PlannerService and the WeekdayPlannerService.
      Parameters:
      weekdays - the list of weekdays for which tasks' points should be reset
      See Also:
      • createCleanerListener(int)
      • addListenerToButtons()
